snippet: Some said they were angry over what they called the youths’ seemingly cavalier behavior in the West Bank, but others said the infrequent bus service left people no option but to hitch a ride.
abstract: Three Israeli teenagers kidnapped by Palestinian militants while hitchhiking in West Bank have provoked outpouring of sympathy in Israel's ordinarily fractious society; abductions have stirred more hushed debate, however, over conduct of Jewish settlers in West Bank and price that Israel has paid to redeem its captives.

byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Some said they were angry over what they called the youths’ seemingly cavalier behavior in the West Bank, but others said the infrequent bus service left people no option but to hitch a ride.

headline.main: Abduction of Young Israeli Hitchhikers Spurs Debate on Conduct
headline.print_headline: Abduction of Young Israeli Hitchhikers Spurs Debate on Conduct
